result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert V Lowery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.   $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.    Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including an AODA assessment, anger management, and domestic violence counseling.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert V Lowery

DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim EAB (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Albert V Lowery in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Albert V Lowery in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
